int is_valid(int s0, int s1, int s2, int s3) {

    // Check original and three swaps

    int arr[4][4] = {

        {s0, s1, s2, s3}, // original

        {s1, s0, s2, s3}, // swap 0-1

        {s0, s2, s1, s3}, // swap 1-2

        {s0, s1, s3, s2}  // swap 2-3

    };

    for (int k = 0; k <4; k++) {

        int a0 = arr[k][0];

        int a1 = arr[k][1];

        int a2 = arr[k][2];

        int a3 = arr[k][3];

        // Check for AGC in positions 0-2: a0=0, a1=2, a2=1

        if (a0 == 0 && a1 == 2 && a2 == 1) {

            return 0;

        }

        // Check for AGC in positions 1-3: a1=0, a2=2, a3=1

        if (a1 ==0 && a2 ==2 && a3 ==1) {

            return 0;

        }

    }

    return 1;

}

Initialize dp[0][63] = 1.

For each step i from 0 to N-1:

               dp[i+1][new_state] = (dp[i+1][new_state] + dp[i][state]) % MOD

So, after processing all steps, the answer is the sum of all dp[N][state] for all states.

So, the code would have:

long long dp[2][64];

int prev = 0;

memset(dp[prev], 0, sizeof(dp[prev]));

dp[prev][63] = 1; // initial state "TTT"

for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {

    int curr = 1 - prev;

    memset(dp[curr], 0, sizeof(dp[curr]));

    for (int state = 0; state <64; state++) {

        if (dp[prev][state] == 0) continue;

        // decompose state into s0, s1, s2

        int s0 = state / 16;

        int s1 = (state /4) %4;

        int s2 = state %4;

        for (int c =0; c <4; c++) {

            int s3 = c;

            // check if valid

            if (is_valid(s0, s1, s2, s3)) {

                int new_state = (s1 *4 + s2) *4 + c;

                dp[curr][new_state] = (dp[curr][new_state] + dp[prev][state]) % MOD;

            }

        }

    }

    prev = curr;

}

After N steps, the answer is the sum of dp[prev][state] for all states.

int is_valid(int s0, int s1, int s2, int s3) {

    int i;

    // Check original and three swaps.

    int cases[4][4] = {

        {s0, s1, s2, s3},

        {s1, s0, s2, s3},

        {s0, s2, s1, s3},

        {s0, s1, s3, s2}

    };

    for (i =0; i <4; i++) {

        int a0 = cases[i][0];

        int a1 = cases[i][1];

        int a2 = cases[i][2];

        int a3 = cases[i][3];

        // Check for AGC in positions 0-2 (a0, a1, a2)

        if (a0 ==0 && a1 ==2 && a2 ==1) {

            return 0;

        }

        // Check for AGC in positions 1-3 (a1, a2, a3)

        if (a1 ==0 && a2 ==2 && a3 ==1) {

            return 0;

        }

    }

    return 1;

}

The C code:

#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#define MOD 1000000007LL

int is_valid(int s0, int s1, int s2, int s3) {

    int cases[4][4] = {

        {s0, s1, s2, s3},

        {s1, s0, s2, s3},

        {s0, s2, s1, s3},

        {s0, s1, s3, s2}

    };

    for (int i = 0; i <4; ++i) {

        int a0 = cases[i][0];

        int a1 = cases[i][1];

        int a2 = cases[i][2];

        int a3 = cases[i][3];

        if (a0 ==0 && a1 ==2 && a2 ==1) return 0;

        if (a1 ==0 && a2 ==2 && a3 ==1) return 0;

    }

    return 1;

}

int main() {

    int N;

    scanf("%d", &N);

    long long dp[2][64];

    int prev = 0;

    memset(dp[prev], 0, sizeof(dp[prev]));

    dp[prev][63] = 1; // Initial state TTT (3,3,3) → 3*16 +3*4 +3 = 63

    for (int i =0; i <N; ++i) {

        int curr = 1 - prev;

        memset(dp[curr], 0, sizeof(dp[curr]));

        for (int state =0; state <64; ++state) {

            if (dp[prev][state] ==0) continue;

            int s0 = state /16;

            int s1 = (state /4) %4;

            int s2 = state %4;

            for (int c=0; c<4; ++c) {

                if (is_valid(s0, s1, s2, c)) {

                    int new_state = (s1 *4 + s2) *4 + c;

                    dp[curr][new_state] = (dp[curr][new_state] + dp[prev][state]) % MOD;

                }

            }

        }

        prev = curr;

    }

    long long ans =0;

    for (int state =0; state <64; ++state) {

        ans = (ans + dp[prev][state]) % MOD;

    }

    printf("%lld\n", ans);

    return 0;

}

Wait, but in the transition, new_state is (s1 *4 + s2) *4 + c. Which is s1 *16 + s2*4 +c. Which is the new state composed of s1, s2, c. That's correct.
